synthesis.procedure: A mixture of TMC4R, Co(NO3)2·6H2O, 1,4-BDC, and 0.2 M NaOH (two drops) was put into a mixed solution of DMF/MeOH/CH3CN (8 mL, 2/5/1, v/v/v) in a Teflon reactor (15 mL) and heated at 90 °C for 3 days. After cooling to room temperature, pink octahedral crystals of Co-TMC4R-BDC were achieved in a 52% yield based on TMC4R.

fabrication.procedure: Bulk Co-TMC4R-BDC sample was fully ground, and then the powder (3.0 mg) was dispersed in 0.5% Nafion solution (1.0 mL) and treated with ultrasound for 15 min to give uniform suspension. Different volumes of Co-TMC4R-BDC suspension (3.0 mg∙mL−1), including 3.0, 4.0, 5.0, 6.0 and 7.0 μL, were dropped onto the polished and clean GCEs (diameter = 3 mm) surface, respectively. Finally, the modified electrodes were dried under an infrared heat lamp. Electrochemical pretreatment was conducted by passing the electrode through several cyclic voltammograms from − 1.0 to 1.0 V for ten times in acetate buffer solution (ABS, pH = 5.0).

electrochemical_test_methods.CVs_and_EIS: Determined under static conditions in a mixed solution of 0.1 M KCl solution and 5.0 mM [Fe(CN)6]3−/4− with an impedance frequency range of 0.01–10.0 KHz.
electrochemical_test_methods.SWASV: Applied to quantificationally detect Cd2+, Pb2+, Cu2+ and Hg2+ in a quartz beaker with the three-electrode system (frequency: 15 Hz, amplitude: 25 mV, step voltage: 4 mV, quiet time: 2 s). The modified electrode was immersed in 0.2 M ABS (pH = 5.0) containing Cd2+, Pb2+, Cu2+ or Hg2+ in different concentrations. The deposition step was determined at −1.3 V for 360 s with stirring. Then the stripping process was swept from −1.0 to 0.6 V.
